attributes.action: Stop including people who are in the armed forces from being part of claims for Benefit when they are not actually living there but are only using it as a postal address as they are out of the country fighting for us.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Currently if someone is claiming Housing and Council Tax Benefit and has a son/daughter who is in the armed forces who does not actually live with them that son/daughter are still counted as living there if they use it as a postal address or apply for credit there as they do not have a permanente address elsewhere and only stay a couple of times a year when on leave. This can result in a large non-dependant deduction of up to £47.75 per week which the person claiming benefit then has to pay towards their rent and £6.95 per week towards there council tax.
